entry.title: well, aren't you just the greatest goddamn thing?
entry.summary:
Author: infinitesage

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 22,896Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 74

Summary: Everyone loved Dick Grayson. And for the longest time, Jason resented it. Resented how effortlessly he earned affection, how easily he was adored by the world. It was all too much.Or, where Jason Todd finds out that there is a despicably thin line between wanting to be someone and wanting to be with someone. He realised the former a long time ago, but it took him literally dying and coming back to life to realise the latter.Inspired by Olivia Rodrigo’s “Lacy.”

entry.title: We Can't See the Skyline
entry.summary:
Author: Rawrbin

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 30,790Chapters: 15/25Kudos: 576

Summary: Jason Todd is a struggling college student, part-time mechanic, and full-time closeted homosexual, just trying to get by in Park Row. When he needs a roommate in order to pay the bills, fate delivers him Dick Grayson, a charming man with a mysterious past. Jason suspects they may have more in common than they can speak out loud. Will he be able to keep their roommate relationship platonic? And what is Dick Grayson's real history?

entry.title: Cloven Tongues Like as of Fire
entry.summary:
Author: YouHaveForgottenMeAlready

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 23,926Chapters: 3/4Kudos: 133

Summary: "Stay there," Jason growled. It gave Dick pause and he frowned. What was bothering him, exactly? It hit him suddenly and he wanted to laugh. Jason had given the command in French."Stay?" Dick replied, but he kept it in English, thank you very much. A reminder of where Jason had been while he was away from him—leaving Dick to sleep alone without him—was unwanted."Oh, yes. The view is nice. I've been away too long. Counted the minutes until I could see that ass." Jason swearing in French was titillating somehow.Dick tilted his head to the side."French?" he said. "You're hitting on me in French? You've come back from France and now you're forcing me to remember French?""You speak it, why not?" Jason said.Jason and Dick lead dangerous lives. They make their new relationship work. Somehow. But Jason's life is made more dangerous by his intimate proximity to Death. His time on the other side changed him in troubling, fascinating ways.Dick learns a terrible truth the hard way: the dead can speak. Sometimes, those nearest to them are able to listen. What the dead say could spell disaster for Gotham, and possibly the whole world.

entry.title: Broken Wings, Invincible Hearts
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,539Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 38

Summary: In this crossover universe, Jason Todd is reborn—not in Gotham, but in a sterile government lab under the supervision of Cecil Stedman. Engineered from Viltrumite DNA forcibly obtained from Omni-Man and a second, unidentified genetic source, Jason was never meant to survive. He was a contingency, a secret weapon—one even Nolan wasn’t supposed to know about. But when Omni-Man discovered the experiment, his trust in Cecil shattered. Furious at the violation, he took the child anyway—claiming Jason as his own, raising him alongside Mark, and severing all ties with the agency that created his second son.Jason and Mark grow up as twins in everything but blood. Yet only Jason remembers his former life. Once Robin, then Red Hood, he is haunted by a Gotham that no longer exists, and shaped by trauma that no one else understands. Meanwhile, Mark Grayson—kind, bright, and unknowing—is the reincarnation of Dick Grayson. Though his memories remain locked away, something deep within him reacts to Jason with the ache of familiarity. They orbit each other with a bond too complex to name: family, yes—but also partners, mirrors, rivals, and something more. The emotional entanglement only deepens once their powers begin to emerge.

entry.title: Not Until You Say Goodbye
entry.summary:
Author: Mat_Vibes

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 84,952Chapters: 18/?Kudos: 32

Summary: What if the end of the world wasn’t just about destruction—but about love rewriting fate?Do you love the Batfamily? Do you love Evangelion?Never heard of one, the other, or either?Doesn’t matter—this story is for YOU.Join Tim Drake as he navigates a futuristic world full of towering robots, emotional breakdowns, and extremely loud brothers.Even if you’re new to either fandom, don’t worry—every character is introduced clearly, and the story blends the chaos of Evangelion with the heart (and dysfunction) of the Batfamily to create something entirely new.If you're here for plot, we’ve got it.If you're here for smut, we’ve got that too (clearly tagged and totally skippable if you prefer to keep things sweet and safe.)

entry.title: False Front
entry.summary:
Author: SavioroftheStars

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 192,367Chapters: 20/?Kudos: 493

Summary: Dick Grayson is an undercover agent, tasked with infiltrating the Red Hoods, a dangerous new gang with a strict code of ethics. Posing as Ricky Kelly, a former sex worker with a fabricated past, Dick is sent to gain the trust of their leader, the mysterious and unpredictable Red Hood. As he works his way deeper into the gang, Dick quickly realizes that the Red Hoods are unlike any other criminal organization he’s encountered—disciplined, strategic, and governed by a unique moral code.But things become complicated when Dick finds himself developing feelings for their enigmatic leader and growing closer with the people he was sent to deceive.

entry.title: performing, or living
entry.summary:
Author: chasm_side

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 29,009Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 126

Summary: "Everyone tells themselves little stories about who they are," she told him. "Stories about why they do what they do, why they want what they want. And that's fine—telling a story isn't the same as telling a lie, you know?" "Sure," Dick agreed. "It only gets fucked up when you start thinking your story is the only story worth believing," Jay said. "That you've got some kind of monopoly on truth, that you're the only person who gets to tell other people what's really real. So… if you let me have my little stories, I'll let you have yours. If you need to believe in Batman, if you need Bruce to be a good father, if you need to roll around in your shame about not being honest with Daddy about all the awesome sex you're having with the most problematic of Daddy's problem children—I mean, sure, whatever gets you off, right?" Dick Grayson navigates the line between fantasy and reality, tries to be a better man, has increasingly kinky sex with his pseudo-sister, and refuses to have a crisis about any of it. Jay's taking everything in stride, so why shouldn't Dick learn to accept a little volatility in his civilian life? It's only as Nightwing that he has to care about control.
